milestone.description: This version will focus on processing two of the major outstanding pull requests, James Urquhart's [TorqueScript interpreter improvements](https://github.com/GarageGames/Torque3D/pull/81) and Tim Condon's [GUI additions](https://github.com/GarageGames/Torque3D/pull/545). Along with that we'll be bringing in lots of other TS-related enhancements, adding unit tests for TS to make sure we don't break your games, and processing even more of the outstanding issue list.

data.title: checkInFoV correction
data.body:
requested:
https://github.com/GarageGames/Torque3D/issues/1009
crosscheck vs https://github.com/GarageGames/Torque3D/blob/69838bdc8c9bc055b9b1ae76f42b0f28d2a33909/Engine/source/T3D/fps/guiShapeNameHud.cpp#L177-L240 upon which that was based.

data.title: AIPlayer::checkInFoV doesn't work as intended - incorrect math
data.body:
The comparison at the end of AIPlayer::checkInFov should be comparing the dot product of the view and target vectors to the cosine of camFov, e.g.
return ( dot > mCos( camFov ) );

data.title: ParticleEditor.ed.gui uses the old license header.
data.body:
Just stumbled across this:
https://github.com/GarageGames/Torque3D/blob/development/Templates/Full/game/tools/particleEditor/ParticleEditor.ed.gui

Perhaps a search for other files using old license header would be a good idea? I don't care enough to PR it though... Someone fix! :P

data.body:
When scene has zero lights sources actives, last `RenderTexTargetBinManager`render target  are used for render. This cause render artifatcs.

![screenshot 2014-12-03 23 48 13](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2388307/5290412/e0372976-7b46-11e4-8556-19bbb8190648.png)

Thx @Lopuska for the fix :)

For replicate:
- Remove or hidde all light sources on editor.

data.title: Added Drop To Ground functionality to Forest, needs new icon though
data.body: Situation is a level designer places a forest, then changes the elevation of the ground under the forest.  This allows them to just drop all the forest items back onto the ground without having to erase them and replace them.

milestone.title: OpenGL3
milestone.description:
This milestone tracks the progress of adding an OpenGL rendering backend to the engine alongside the current DirectX backend, which is unfortunately the only backend of the abstracted GFX interface. This will allow OpenGL rendering on multiple platforms, but specifically OXS and Linux.

[Working branch.](https://github.com/BeamNG/Torque3D/tree/dev_linux_opengl)

data.title: Linux Mint ( Nvidia GTX 650) engine does not start.
data.body:
Hi I download and compile the latest souce, 
Compilation was succesfull, but i was not able to start the engine.
I use Linux Mint winth NVIDIA GTX 650 (NVIDIA drivers 340.58) 

I Folowed the README.md  instructions and steps, and i create a new project "rafman" based on Full.

The output on my system was the bellow:

rafman@hermes ~/Torque3D-development/My Projects/rafman/game $ ./rafman -dedicated -mission "levels/Empty Terrain.mis"

milestone.title: OpenGL3
milestone.description:
This milestone tracks the progress of adding an OpenGL rendering backend to the engine alongside the current DirectX backend, which is unfortunately the only backend of the abstracted GFX interface. This will allow OpenGL rendering on multiple platforms, but specifically OXS and Linux.

[Working branch.](https://github.com/BeamNG/Torque3D/tree/dev_linux_opengl)
